metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11600 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
net/xfrm/xfrm_policy.c in the Linux kernel through 4.12.3, when CONFIG_XFRM_MIGRATE is enabled, does not ensure that the dir value of xfrm_userpolicy_id is XFRM_POLICY_MAX or less, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via an XFRM_MSG_MIGRATE xfrm Netlink message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1

notes.Note: sbeattie> queued in davem's net tree only affects kernels with CONFIG_XFRM_MIGRATE enabled
